trans-unit.source: Customizes the behavior of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl"></xref> object with which the adapter is associated for specific browser requests.

A control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class is bound to a data source and generates its user interface or child control hierarchy by enumerating the items in the data source to which it is bound.

<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> is an abstract base class that defines the common characteristics of all controls that can be bound to a data source, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> controls.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl>.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Adapters.DataBoundControlAdapter> modifies the behavior of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> for a specific browser or class of browsers, or acts as a filter on some capability.
Much of the adaptability in rendering behavior can be encapsulated in the specialized classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class.

Therefore, it is likely that a single adapter can be used for a number of browser class behaviors or that inclusion of the adaptability in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> classes can make the use of a control adapter unnecessary.
Each control has explicit mappings to adapters through the .browser definition files, if there are `<controlAdapter>` entries in these files.

Thus, any access to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Adapter%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> uses the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> object extracted from the .browser definition files to perform the lookup for the mapping of the adapter to control.
During processing, the .NET Framework intercepts calls to the methods of a control that could be browser specific.
If a control adapter is attached, the .NET Framework calls the associated adapter methods.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.ControlAdapter>.

The M:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Adapters.DataBoundControlAdapter.PerformDataBinding(System.Collections.IEnumerable) method binds an enumerable collection to the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Adapters.DataBoundControlAdapter.Control%2A> property returns a strongly typed reference to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Adapters.DataBoundControlAdapter"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Adapters.DataBoundControlAdapter> class when it creates the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Adapters.DataBoundControlAdapter> object.
Retrieves a strongly-typed reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl"></xref> object associated with this control adapter.

When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Adapters.DataBoundControlAdapter> object is attached to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> control, the .NET Framework calls certain adapter members instead of the control members.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl"></xref> to which this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Adapters.DataBoundControlAdapter"></xref> is attached.
Binds the data in the data source of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl"></xref> object to the control adapter.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Adapters.DataBoundControlAdapter.PerformDataBinding%2A> method is called in place of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Adapters.DataBoundControlAdapter> control adapter is attached to a control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> class.

Typically, an override of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformDataBinding%2A?displayProperty=fullName> iterates through data, creating distinct names and values when necessary, and saves it to an internal collection.

Usually, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.RenderContents%2A> or a similar method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl> will populate the user interface or child controls from that internal collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> of <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to be bound to the derived <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl"></xref>.
